mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS REWARD--Will be paid for the apprehension and delivery in the New Orleans Jail, of the negro man (slave) WILLIAM MORSE alias JACKO, who ran away, on the 5th of May last, from the residence of Mr. A. Denis, in this city. William, or Jacko, is about 25 years old, and of about medium size and hight, very black, teeth much decayed, somewhat bow-legged, very intelligent, and speaks English and French. The above reward will be paid for his delivery in Jail, in this city, and the further sum of one hundred dollars will also be paid for the conviction of the persons harboring him. R. BRUGIER, 7 St. Louis street. je14 6t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
